name: Research Reflaxe MarkUnusedVariablesImpl Integration
description: Investigate whether we can/should use Reflaxe's built-in MarkUnusedVariablesImpl preprocessor instead of our custom HygieneTransforms usage analysis. The reference implementations show Reflaxe has comprehensive variable handling infrastructure that we may not be leveraging properly.
implementationGuide: INVESTIGATION TASKS: 1. Read MarkUnusedVariablesImpl.hx from reference directory at /Users/fullofcaffeine/workspace/code/haxe.elixir.reference/reflaxe/src/reflaxe/preprocessors/implementations/MarkUnusedVariablesImpl.hx - Understand how it marks variables with -reflaxe.unused metadata - Check if it handles pattern-bound variables correctly. 2. Check Our Preprocessor Usage: Search ElixirCompiler.hx for preprocessor initialization, see which Reflaxe preprocessors we're currently using, determine if we're enabling MarkUnusedVariablesImpl. 3. Compare approaches between current custom HygieneTransforms.usageAnalysisPass and Reflaxe's MarkUnusedVariablesImpl. 4. Make recommendation: If MarkUnusedVariablesImpl handles pattern variables correctly then use it, otherwise document why and proceed with HygieneTransforms fix. SUCCESS CRITERIA: Clear decision on using Reflaxe preprocessor OR custom HygieneTransforms with justification documented.
notes: This is CRITICAL research before implementing fixes. Using established Reflaxe infrastructure is always better than reinventing.
verificationCriteria: Research complete with clear architectural decision documented
